reviews.review_msg: best class i've had in my two years at sfu.
a really good professor --- good, clear lectures with clear and organized power point, always helpful and is enthusiastic about subject.

Professor Klager always took the time out to help with my assignments and gave immediate in-depth advice on how to make them better.  His lectures were clear and organized, though very challenging sometime, but i like that since this is university and not high school, the textbook went with the lectures well but he sometimes was out of sink.
great prof and interesting class. textbook is good but not necessary since there aren't any exams. TA was also very helpful.

Textbook is not necessary, first few weeks of lectures are the same. Attendance not mandatory; no exams or tests. Mark is from 3 papers, easy despite people's complaints, little work needed relative to other courses.

great prof who shows he cares about students and how well they are doing in the course, is a fair marker and his lectures are interesting and very clear. Easy to understand power point and uses lots of good videos. I didn't know much about the course subject but I learned a lot. Would definately take another course from him!

Treats a lower level course as if it is a 3rd or 4th year coarse. Uses redundent language in lectures/assignments and is very hard to understant. Rambles on about petty information in lectures and never finshes on time. If it wasnt for the TA I wouldnt understand anything he said.
Good helpful prof, easy to understand and provided assistance whenever asked for.
